item.title: Puzzles #1 (heyawake)
item.description:
https://puzz.link/p?heyawake/10/10/l9aik2r5m35mbcmkd8s00vvv00usu0001v00i22g2j2g3g4h1h
This is the first standard logic puzzle I made – I don't think it's very good, but it's not bad either.

item.title: Puzzles #2 (shakashaka)
item.description:
https://puzz.link/p?shakashaka/10/10/u.i.bncgcj.t.ldgdn2bg.u
This one is well worth doing logically – the deductions aren't hard but work well together.

item.title: Puzzles #4 (heyawake x2)
item.description:
https://puzz.link/p?heyawake/19/15/201480mhg2i40a8s192816704r503gk0m2g2oa0a18085010k046g0003hu0104000400fbvgvo005fu1800o0000000800600000003s0003c-1c140411g81ah8233 https://puzz.link/p?-610190g51011103131345g34356
I made these puzzles to demonstrate how "penalty theory" in Heyawake can be applied locally. The first can be solved with standard deductions somewhat painfully, so to fix that I made the second one, which definitely requires penalty theory to be solved by a human (and is quite an interesting design in its own right).

item.title: Puzzles #6 (yajilin)
item.description:
https://puzz.link/p?yajilin/10/10/t23g33o12a41e30t42e12g32l
Not too easy, not too hard.

item.title: Puzzles #7 (shakashaka)
item.description:
https://puzz.link/p?shakashaka/12/9/idzudbt.ubm.ncj.hb
Was trying to make a shakashaka to demonstrate some basic deductions, but ended up with a mediocre puzzle instead, which was just decent enough to not throw away.

item.title: Puzzles #8 (tateyoko x3)
item.description:
https://puzz.link/p?tateyoko/10/10/4i43i31n1nr1n11qi2p2n2n1q1i41i2p2i3p1n2i434i44n1pi31ri23i41q1n2n2pi2q11n1pn1n2i35i43 https://puzz.link/p?tateyoko/10/10/xn112i2pn2n8i62npnq1p1qnpi88i2pn21pn1npnpi3pi3p2i32i22n1npnqnpnqnpi62i31xn11n1npn1 https://puzz.link/p?tateyoko/10/10/2n2n1i43n1n1i21n2n2npn2i2qi32nqi2pn3n1n2n22i831n3n3n2nqi2sn3i3ri22npn1n2n2i23n3n3i43n2n2
A triplet with varying forms of symmetry! It's hard to make a Tatebo-Yokobo with nontrivial logic, so these difficulty ratings are relative to the type. It's especially hard with symmetry and theme constraints, but I did my best with these.Thanks a ton to @lovemathboy for testing these (and notifying me two were broken)!

item.title: Puzzles #9 (akari x2)
item.description:
https://puzz.link/p?akari/13/11/gbqcnb66.g5a.h.w.ocm.w.h.h55.g6bbncqb https://puzz.link/p?akari/24/24/.gaj.k.g.zncpczu.kbp.k.lbi77cch.j.jbk81bocm.m7ch.h6.h.h.n7.ibq7.h7.gbm.nbj165bh6.g.cjbl.o6.gb.gbqbg.gblab6.hbh.g.m.obo.8bkbhahbhc75.kbjcibpbibzucpbzl5bibj.ga
The first one is a mini-demo of a deduction required for the second one, so it's a bit of a spoiler for the big puzzle.

item.title: Puzzles #10 (araf)
item.description:
https://puzz.link/p?araf/10/11/1l6p7q4467h5g55q7g7647g1q-108g-10h-1075-10q9p-10ld
At the time of writing, there are only 6 Araf puzzles in the puzz.link database. So I decided to fix that!Thanks to @IHNN and @jkittykitkat for testing and catching a uniqueness issue.

item.title: Puzzles #11 (akari x3)
item.description:
https://puzz.link/p?akari/10/10/5.ibudg.hbi.gbx6.kc.ibubg7./ https://puzz.link/p?akari/10/10/bbi.wcbq.paqccubib./ https://puzz.link/p?akari/10/10/hbjbn.i.hcp.jclbhap.hbg.pbjb
A few moderately interesting Akari around the same logical theme -- the difficulty on these is hard to calibrate because they're quite easy if you know the deductions and quite hard if you don't, so I've set them at mid.

(wedded seal 1: Shading Puzzles 1/2)This is the first post in a series in which I will attempt to create one puzzle in each genre implemented on puzzlink over the course of ~5 months, one puzzle a day. I'm going in order by category, so this is the first half of the Shading Puzzles category.This series was inspired by @mstang, who is also writing one puzzle a day during this month in imitation of bachelor seal (who's written 3 puzzles a day for a very long time) -- so together we are wedded seal :P
